page.title: 07SOLIHULL PARKWAY HOSPITAL
page.content: The hospital is a new purpose built unit designed and equipped to treat acute medical or surgical conditions. It is a private hospital built on land which is convenient to the Solihull by-pass and the M42. It was opened in 1983 and a further development of a sports injury unit was opened in 1985 by the athlete, Sebastian Coe. The hospital has 38 beds including 32 single rooms with many comforts such as a telephone, television and bathroom. The hospital has provided a few new jobs especially for ancillary workers. Many patients are short stay cases and belong to private medical schemes, although you can pay direct by cash or credit card.
